repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Development policy loan
            "Fiscal Consolidation for Efficiency and Growth"

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the development
            policy loan "Fiscal Consolidation for Efficiency and
            Growth" to the municipality of Rio de Janeiro in Brazil
            was deemed to be highly satisfactory, with satisfactory
            performances by the Bank and the borrower. The relevance of
            the program objectives and design were rated as high. All
            but one of the results indicators were shown to be fully
            successful in achieving their targets, while one was
            partially successful. The crucial lessons learned during the
            implementation of the project were: 1) the essentiality of
            strong and effective political leadership; 2) the importance
            of political economy; and 3) the role of flexibility in
            opening up new possibilities.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Municipality of Rio de Janeiro for
            Fiscal Consolidation for Efficiency and Growth Development
            Policy Loan Project : release of the second tranche - full compliance

abstracts.cdata!:
This two-tranche Development Policy Loan
            (DPL) of US$1,045 million to the Municipality of Rio de
            Janeiro (MoRJ) in Brazil was signed on August 20, 2010, and
            became effective on August 27, 2010. The first tranche of
            US$ 545 million was disbursed on August 31, 2010. The second
            tranche of US$500 million is to be disbursed upon completion
            of specific tranche release conditions related to the
            government's reform program. The loan supports the
            government in its efforts to achieve faster, more equitable
            and sustainable growth by increasing investment to improve
            the quality and coverage of social services, particularly in
            vulnerable areas of the city and to strengthen public sector
            management. This DPL is fully consistent with and closely
            linked to the objectives of the proposed new Brazil Country
            Partnership Strategy (CPS) 2012-2015. The new CPS discussed
            by the Board on November 1, 2011, which focus on creating
            opportunities for growth and employment, targeting the poor
            and vulnerable, strengthening governance and promoting
            global collective action, as well as stimulating private
            sector innovation and competitiveness.
